label: Genomic-Epigenomic-Morphogenetic
description: Defines the informational hardware of the organism. This layer governs the storage (genomic), long-term retrieval (epigenetic), and physical expression (morphogenetic) of biological information. It forms the physical blueprint that is read out by L2 and guided by L1.

coreMechanisms.name: Epigenetic Regulation
coreMechanisms.description: The dynamic modification of chromatin (e.g., methylation, histone states) that controls gene expression, defining the cell's long-term identity and state.

coreMechanisms.name: Morphogenetic Bioelectric Fields
coreMechanisms.description: The generation of stable, large-scale bioelectric patterns that act as a scaffold or blueprint for cellular organization, development, and regeneration.

coreMechanisms.name: CISS-Bioelectric-Chromatin (CBC) Bridge
coreMechanisms.description: The primary L1->L3 interface. Proposes that spin-polarized electrons from Layer 1's Chiral-Induced Spin Selectivity (CISS) effect are guided by L3 bioelectric fields (L3.M2) to directly influence the epigenetic state (L3.M1) of chromatin.

coreMechanisms.name: Quantum Field Theory of Morphogenesis
coreMechanisms.description: Models the emergent morphogenetic field as a Klein-Gordon (QFT) field, providing a formal physical basis for developmental guidance.

interfacePoints.description: Receives spin-polarized information from the CISS effect (L1.M1) to execute the CBC Bridge.
Provides the 'hardware' (e.g., specific ion channels, receptors) whose expression is modulated by L3, thereby defining the operational parameters of the L2 neurotransmitter economy.
The bioelectric fields (L3.M2) provide a slow, stable context that guides the emergence of the faster UPDE-based synchronization in L4.

validation.description: Validates the 'CISS' component of the L3.M3 bridge.
Validates the 'Bioelectric' component of the L3.M3 bridge and L3.M2.
Validates the 'Chromatin' component of the L3.M3 bridge and L3.M1.
Validates the entire L3.M3 CISS-Bioelectric-Chromatin cascade as a coherent, functional mechanism.
Validates L3.M4, modeling the emergence of morphogenetic fields from the quantum substrate.
